examples: Health services are lining the drug companies’ pockets, according to the report.
The presence of green algae in water bodies can indicate the health and balance of the ecosystem.
Years of smoking and drinking has taken a toll on her health.
Support your thyroid health by incorporating bladderwrack supplements into your daily routine.
Public education campaigns highlight potential health risks of consuming pink slime products.
words.defineEn: the state of being free from illness or injury
words.defineVi: tình trạng không bị bệnh tật hoặc thương tích

examples: Life goes on.
Life is unfair.
That experience changed my life.
Does life exist on other planets?
Life is just a bowl of cherries these days!
words.defineEn: the state of existing as a person who is alive
words.defineVi: trạng thái tồn tại như một người đang sống

examples: She felt her mother's death very deeply.
Her death should serve as a warning to other young people.
He met his death in 1946.
Today's lecture bored me to death.
Some of my patients are actually staring death in the face.
words.defineEn: the end of life; the act of dying
words.defineVi: cuối đời; hành động chết

examples: He followed a strict diet.
She valued the high nutritional content and low-calorie nature of asparagus in his diet.
We existed on a diet of rice.
She includes thin slices of celery in her diet.
They lived frugally off a diet of beans and lentils.
words.defineEn: a set of food that is eaten to keep healthy, thin, etc.
words.defineVi: một bộ thực phẩm được ăn để giữ sức khỏe, mỏng, vv

examples: Save some energy for the end of the race.
Lower energy consumption means less pollution.
Recycling waste saves energy.
Her energy and talent took her to the top of her profession.
The teacher spends a lot of energy planning a good lesson.
words.defineEn: the physical and mental strength required for activity, work, etc.
words.defineVi: sức mạnh thể chất và tinh thần cần thiết cho hoạt động, công việc, v.v.

examples: Don't make a habit of it.
The toddler imitated his mother's habit of biting her nails.
Lying is considered a bad habit.
Laura has a habit of rubbing people the wrong way.
She gave me a flea in my ear over my spending habits.
words.defineEn: something that you regularly do almost without thinking about it, particularly one that is hard to give up or stop doing
words.defineVi: điều gì đó mà bạn thường xuyên làm hầu như không nghĩ về nó, đặc biệt là điều khó từ bỏ hoặc ngừng làm

examples: Regular exercise and healthy eating habits can prevent many illnesses as prevention is better than cure.
We never spoke about her illness.
You may find your illness hard to accept.
Emily had just recovered from her illness and was now in the pink of health.
The doctor examined her body to check for any signs of illness or injury.
words.defineEn: the state of being physically or mentally ill; a period of sickness or disease
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị bệnh về thể chất hoặc tinh thần; một thời kỳ ốm đau hoặc bệnh tật

examples: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke.
Newer treatments for the disease are in the pipeline.
As with all diseases, certain groups will be more at risk than others.
Efforts were made to check the disease.
Efforts to stop the spread of the disease.
words.defineEn: an illness in a human, animal, or plant that affects health
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh ở người, động vật hoặc thực vật ảnh hưởng đến sức khỏe

examples: She felt aches and pains in her body after a long day of physical activity.
The flu always comes with aches and pains, making it difficult to move around and carry out daily tasks.
Sally understood from Peter's words that even though outwardly he seemed happy, every heart has its own ache that others cannot always see.
Headache, fever, nausea, muscle aches.
So I had muscle aches and fatigue.
words.defineEn: a continuous, but dull (not acute) feeling of pain in a part of the body
words.defineVi: cảm giác đau liên tục nhưng âm ỉ (không cấp tính) ở một bộ phận của cơ thể

examples: There are a few different things that can cause earaches.
And that’s why an earache is painful.
If you’ve ever had an earache, you know just how much that can make your ears hurt!
words.defineEn: a pain inside the ear
words.defineVi: một cơn đau bên trong tai

examples: Has your headache gone yet?
I've got a headache.
He applied a few drops of spikenard oil to his temples, finding relief from his headache.
The vexatious customer continued to make unreasonable demands, causing a headache for the customer service representative.
All that driving has given me a headache.
words.defineEn: a pain in the head, usually persistent
words.defineVi: đau đầu, thường dai dẳng

examples: So we've gone to our doctor for the headaches or the stomach aches and they say everything is fine or they give us some medicine and nothing really helps it, and we still feel it every day.
But for most of human history, drinking from the wrong stream or well could get you the last stomach ache you’d ever have.
They can give people a stomach ache, or make them feel like throwing up, or much worse!
But even eating small amounts of hydrangea will make your digestive tract cells unhappy and cause diarrhea, vomiting, and stomach ache.
words.defineEn: a pain in or near someone's stomach
words.defineVi: một cơn đau trong hoặc gần dạ dày của ai đó

examples: These could be anything from backaches and stomachaches to morning sickness and food cravings.
WILLIAM BRANGHAM: Meaning, so you could have people getting backaches after getting their shots and make an association, but they may have no bearing whatsoever.
words.defineEn: a pain in someone's back
words.defineVi: một nỗi đau ở lưng của ai đó

examples: Chewing on a clove can help alleviate a toothache.
But a toothache can be kind of an indicator for something way more serious.
A toothache, for example, can irritate the mandibular nerve causing pain near the central skull.
Two of them were stationed 570 kilometers away when one got a toothache.
And if these workers don't want dental services and prefer being paid in something else like flat-screen TV's, then you have to find TV manufacturers that have toothaches.
words.defineEn: a pain in a tooth
words.defineVi: đau răng

examples: I might be getting the flu.
The flu is going around, and many people in town are as sick as horses.
My friend is afraid he might go down with the flu.
Samantha looked like a bag of bones and feathers after weeks of battling the flu.
The doctor advised me to let the flu run its course, rather than prescribing medication.
words.defineEn: influenza; an infectious disease similar to a bad cold, causing fever and severe pain
words.defineVi: cúm; một bệnh truyền nhiễm tương tự như cảm lạnh nặng, gây sốt và đau dữ dội

examples: The body's immune system protects against harmful bacteria and viruses.
When it comes to cybersecurity, there is no little enemy, and even a seemingly harmless email or file can contain a dangerous virus or malware.
Viruses mutate more often than practically any other organism.
So, much to their surprise, their data-driven approach implicated viruses.
Viruses hate that!
words.defineEn: a microscopic agent that causes disease in people, animals, and plants
words.defineVi: một tác nhân cực nhỏ gây bệnh cho người, động vật và thực vật

examples: The bullets had no effect on the steel door.
The increase had a ripple effect through the whole financial market.
The color green has a restful effect.
The law went into effect on 1 August.
The bank crash has had a ripple effect on the whole community.
words.defineEn: a change in a person or thing caused by another person or thing
words.defineVi: một sự thay đổi trong một người hoặc điều gây ra bởi một người khác hoặc điều

examples: Lots of couples have problems in the first year of marriage.
The problem has now reached crisis point.
The problem was always at the back of my mind.
There are problems.
The problem is all in his head.
words.defineEn: something that causes difficulties and is hard to overcome
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó gây ra khó khăn và khó vượt qua

examples: The child is still running a fever
She had a high fever and needed to see a doctor.
Andy had a fever and a bad case of the flu, and he spent the entire weekend feeling like death warmed over, unable to get out of bed.
I heard that quassia can be used as a remedy for fever.
If you suspect that your child has a fever, you can use a thermometer to measure their temperature.
words.defineEn: a condition when the body temperature rises, usually when we are sick
words.defineVi: một tình trạng khi nhiệt độ cơ thể tăng lên, thường là khi chúng ta bị bệnh

examples: You ought to see a doctor about that cough.
She broke the silence by coughing.
The doctor has given me some medicine to take for my cough.
It just goes to show that love and cough cannot be hidden.
He enjoys a spoonful of honey before bed to help calm his cough and promote a good night's sleep.
words.defineEn: the action of air coming out of our mouth with force
words.defineVi: hành động của không khí thoát ra khỏi miệng của chúng tôi với lực lượng

examples: Guy sneezed loudly.
She sneezed into her elbow to cover her nose.
He sneezes.
Every sneeze starts right inside your nose.
However, this simple sneeze also brings the virus in contact with pets, plants, or even your lunch.
words.defineEn: the act of air blowing out of our nose and mouth in a way that we cannot control
words.defineVi: hành động thổi không khí ra khỏi mũi và miệng theo cách mà chúng ta không thể kiểm soát

examples: He feels the cold a lot.
The film caught a cold over the outstanding debt.
Sarah’s got a cold.
On the day of the wedding, Brown experienced cold feet.
He's out cold and as still as a stone.
words.defineEn: a mild disease that we usually get when viruses affect our body and make us cough, sneeze, or have fever
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh nhẹ mà chúng ta thường mắc phải khi vi-rút ảnh hưởng đến cơ thể và khiến chúng ta ho, hắt hơi hoặc sốt

examples: The aromatic wintergreen tea soothes her sore throat.
We used honey as a natural remedy for soothing a sore throat.
He sipped the steaming chicken broth, feeling its comforting warmth soothe his sore throat.
As a home remedy, I steeped lemongrass in hot water and drank it to relieve a sore throat.
They were feeling a bit under the weather, so they brewed a cup of licorice tea to soothe their sore throat.
words.defineEn: a condition when you feel pain in the throat, usually caused by bacteria or viruses
words.defineVi: một tình trạng khi bạn cảm thấy đau ở cổ họng, thường do vi khuẩn hoặc vi rút gây ra

examples: The medication has a stiff dosage, so be prepared for its potent effects.
I'll be more alert when I get this medication out of my system.
After a few days of rest and medication, Emily is on the mend and expects to be back to work soon.
The doctor advised me to let the flu run its course, rather than prescribing medication.
He had a heart condition that required him to take medication daily.
words.defineEn: something that we take to prevent or treat a disease, or to feel less pain
words.defineVi: thứ gì đó mà chúng ta dùng để ngăn ngừa hoặc điều trị bệnh hoặc để cảm thấy bớt đau

examples: His argument rests on shaky ground.
He gently rested his chin on her shoulder.
The rest of his money went into medical expenses.
May she rest in peace.
I rested my head on a soft pillow to sleep.
words.defineEn: a period of relaxing, sleeping or doing nothing, especially after a period of activity
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian thư giãn, ngủ hoặc không làm gì cả, đặc biệt là sau một thời gian hoạt động

examples: Losing to a younger player was a bitter pill to swallow.
I'm coming up on the ecstasy pill I took earlier.
I think I need a chill pill or two with the day I've had.
I don't know if it's the pills or mind over matter, but I feel different.
Bitter pills may have blessed effects.
words.defineEn: a small round medication we take whole when we are sick
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc tròn nhỏ mà chúng ta uống khi bị ốm

examples: The dentist can't take any new patients.
You have to be patient.
she puts her patients in touch with a great acupuncturist in London.
The treatment has not yet been tried on patients.
The patient's life was hanging by a thread.
words.defineEn: someone who is receiving medical treatment, particularly in a hospital or from a doctor
words.defineVi: một người đang được điều trị y tế, đặc biệt là trong bệnh viện hoặc từ bác sĩ

examples: A cure for lung cancer would save thousands of lives each year.
The upcoming election is a kill or cure moment for the future of the country.
Remember that an ill wound is cured, not an ill name.
Regular exercise and healthy eating habits can prevent many illnesses as prevention is better than cure.
Scientists are still trying to find a cure for cancer.
words.defineEn: a treatment or medication  for a certain disease or injury
words.defineVi: một phương pháp điều trị hoặc thuốc cho một số bệnh hoặc chấn thương

examples: She lived a very peaceful life.
She lives just a stone's throw away from the beach.
He lives far from the city center.
He lived in a small town with friendly neighbors.
She lived in the same village from the cradle to the grave.
words.defineEn: to be or remain alive
words.defineVi: được hoặc vẫn còn sống

examples: The old customs are dying.
All men must die.
The flowers died during a dry spell.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
The die is cast.
words.defineEn: to no longer be alive
words.defineVi: không còn sống

examples: The soup needs a little more seasoning.
This shirt needs washing.
My father's car needs an oil change.
I need a lightweight sweater for the spring season.
We need a new brush for our pet's fur.
words.defineEn: a condition or situation in which something is necessary
words.defineVi: một điều kiện hoặc tình huống trong đó một cái gì đó là cần thiết

words.defineEn: go to sleep; to lie down in one's bed to sleep; prepare to sleep
words.defineVi: đi ngủ; nằm xuống giường để ngủ; chuẩn bị ngủ

examples: King Baldwin the Leper was only sixteen when he learned that Saladin's army was attacking Palestine, and that there was no one to stop them.
Saladin told his men, 'Thinking that Baldwin the Leper is weak because he's young and ill was a mistake!
words.defineEn: someone who is suffering from a chronic, progressive bacterial infection called Leprosy
words.defineVi: một người đang bị nhiễm trùng mãn tính, tiến triển do vi khuẩn gọi là bệnh phong
